description.narrative: Human and Environmental Development Agenda (HEDA Resources Centre) is a non-governmental organisation and non-partisan human rightsand development league. The Centre conducts research, policy advocacy, training, as well as citizens# awareness and mobilization oncore human development issues, including agriculture, food security, climate change, human rights, public sector accountability andelectoral reform processes. HEDA will work with rice and cereal value chain actors in three states to improve market access and marketing of rice for SSFs in the region. We shall organise roundtable meetings and engagements between private sector and SSFs to foster partnerships that will benefit the SSFs. HEDA will work with NASME and other relevant actors to facilitate the meeting; consultants will also be contracted to evaluate and create workable business models for the farmers and private sector. 50 persons will be mobilised for each meeting and IEC materials will be made available for all participants. The reports and outcomes of the meeting will be circulated through agriculture news networks and made into print and CDs. Videos, Photographs and the event will be promoted through traditional media and social media. HEDA will organise a COP 25 TOT inaugural workshop in Abuja. We shall invite relevant stakeholders from different states to deliberate on and localise the lessons learnt from the COP 25 conference. The meeting will consider how the National Agriculture Resilience Framework can align with the global goals while addressing local demands and problems. HEDA will invite various stakeholders within the sector including MDAs, CSOs, SSFs, for this activity and engage relevant consultants to facilitate this workshop. The workshop will include activities to assist the participants in localising the lessons to their agroecological zones. IEC materials will be made available for participants. The event will be promoted through traditional media and social media. A follow up step down workshop will organized for some selected State-level stakeholders in Taraba <(>&<)> Adamawa including representatives of the organized private sector. The reports and outcomes of the meeting will be circulated through agriculturenews networks and made into print and CDs. Videos, Photographs and the event will be promoted through traditional media and social media.

participating-org.narrative: The Human and Environmental Development Agenda is a research and training Centre set up in November 2001 to provide leadership in advancing human rights and environmental protection in public policy and programs. Its focus areas are Human Rights, Environment and Sustainable Development and Good Governance. HEDA works in the area of Environment and Sustainable Development and focuses on promoting food security and protection of livelihoods of small scale women and men farmers. HEDA works mostly with ruraland semi-urban small holder farmers to help increase their resilience to climate change as well as increase their voices in policy making. HEDA provides them with relevant information through its interface with support agencies including Agro MeteorologyDepartment of the Nigeria Meteorological Agency (NIMET), International Institute for Tropical Agriculture (IITA), Nigeria Institute of Oceanography and Marine Research (NIMOR), Federal College of Fisheries among others. HEDA also works with development partners to build the capacity of smallscale men and women farmers to take decisions that help improve their situations as well as enhance their productivity and reduce their vulnerability to hazards. It works with a number of partners which include UNDP,DFID (RIF and SAVI), Foreign and Commonwealth Office, the Government of Japan among others.
